venue.name: UNSW ART & DESIGN

description:
Hi

Where better to see some budding new contemporary artists than COFA's annual opening night party.  Join us after work to explore the many exhibition spaces within the campus, in a buzzing atmosphere with live music.  Be prepared for a crowded event.  We can re-gather around 8pm for a de-brief and perhaps adjourn somewhere for a drink.  CoFAD is just next to the Victoria Barracks, off oxford street. 

Anyhow, here are the details from their website:

‚Ä¢ UNSW Art & Design's ANNUAL is Australia's largest national showcase of graduate contemporary art, design and creative media work.

‚Ä¢ Encompassing multi-site exhibitions and screenings the A&D ANNUAL features an unmatched array of new work by participating creatives spanning; installation, animation, digital media and film, visual communication and graphic design, painting, sculpture, photography, printmaking, sound, spatial design, furniture and jewellery, textile design, design for social innovation, ceramics and more.

‚Ä¢ In 2016 the Annual exhibitions and screenings are presented at venues on and off campus including; ADspace, Kudos Gallery, UNSW Galleries, the Chauvel Cinemas, Blackbox, campus courtyard and the Australian Design Centre.

‚Ä¢ Enjoy a selection of Sydney's best local wine, beer and food vendors at the spectacular opening night party on Tuesday, 29 November, 5 ‚Äì 9pm.

‚Ä¢ The evening will feature live performances and music.

We'll meet outside the gates at 6:15pm, for a 6:30 start:

At the moment I'd like to suggest that - should we split up - we meet back at the main gates (above) around 8pm to head to a nearby pub for a meal and a chat.
name: CoFA  A&D Annual Opening Night Party - Student Graduating Exhibition

description:
The Art Club is a brand new club to explore how the use of art can help you and your business to stand out, to be Seth Godin's 'purple cow', in a world saturated by content and noise, where being different is the only way to get noticed.

The club will explore how art can be great for your wellbeing, relaxing you, and help you to become more creative not just with art but all aspects of you personal and business life.

Art is so overlooked as a tool to help you and your business and we want to explore how you can use it in not just making you stand out with better visual aids, but how it can be used in all aspects of making our work better.

This meetup is for freelancers, artists of all skill levels from beginners. It will be in a fun, judgement-free environment with other like-minded people, who are part of a growing community of creatives, writers and freelancers at @Work Hubs.

We are creating focused sessions to be able to focus on deep work in a world dominated by low-value, repetitive and shallow work.

Come along and have some fun, chill, connect with others and explore how art can bring so much to you and your work.

This week's topic is an introduction to the meetup and what we plan to do over the coming weeks.

This how we roll:

1.30 - 1.45 Introductions
1.45 - 2.15 Discussion on this week's topic
2.15 - 4.15 Art time
4.15 - 4.45 review and discussion of progress

We provide the space to work, we can provide the materials which there is a charge or alternatively you can bring your own. If you don't have materials then there is ¬£10 charge as a donation towards the costs.

We provide fab Nespresso coffee, selection of teas, healthy snacks, wi-fi and chilled water.

So bring your crayons, pencils, paints or chalks.
name: London Art Club - Deep Work

description:
When you've finished a book and you suddenly return to the real world, but the real world feels incomplete or surreal because you're still living in the world of the book.

"I have a really bad book hangover today, I could hardly concentrate at work." That moment when the book ends and you're struggling to get back to the real world? Don't worry, we get it.

Let's meet this Saturday and live this feeling, share experiences and talk about the books you are most attached with. Please register on the URL: https://goo.gl/forms/qVV7rRB1abKgCwRp2

#book #bookover #bookhangover #fantasy #surreal
name: The Book Hangover

description:
Een weekend business challenge is een weekend lang leren over ondernemerschap en daarmee een impact maken door vooral veel te DOEN! Het is een intense ervaring waarin je in een heel korte tijd ontzettend veel leert. In slechts 2 en een halve dag ga je van ANALYSE, via IDEATIE & VALIDATIE, naar PRESENTATIE.

De dagen bestaan zowel uit begeleide sessies, trainingen, werksessie afgewisseld met eet- en ontspanmomenten en ‚Äòfieldtrips‚Äô. Aan het eind van het weekend ben je misschien een beetje moe, maar daarnaast bomvol idee√´n en inspiratie en heb je ‚Äì samen met je team ‚Äì een concreet voorstel gepresenteerd.
Ben je enthousiast genoeg over je project- of bedrijfsvoorstel? Dan kun je deze verder gaan uitwerken in de IMPACT STUDIE of tijdens de VENTURE ACADEMY!

Tijdens dit weekend zoomen wij in op 3 specifieke en relevante challenges voortkomend uit die Omgevingsvisie 2040. Pak je kans om een actieve rol te nemen in het gesprek over de toekomst van jouw stad. Leer meer over de context en de stakeholders van deze uitdagingen. En pitch aan het eind van het weekend jouw project/bedrijfsvoorstel en win 250,1!
name: Weekend Business Challange 2016

description:
Here is how it works:

1. We meet at the Overseas Club at around 7pm. Nearest tram station is Z√ºlpicher Platz.


2. Everyone is talking in German, no English allowed


3. Helpful native German speakers will explain patiently the intricacies and pitfalls of zis beautiful language


4. After about two hours, when everyone's head is spinning already, we will just relax, have a few drinks and switch back to English again


So no matter what level you are, how big your German vocabulary is or how many irregular verbs you can conjugate, come by and enjoy the more practical and fun side of learning a language. German native speakers also very welcome!
name: Practise German @ the Overseas Club + Drinks afterwards

This is a new ride taking in the southern portion of the Pinellas Trail into St. Pete and over to St. Pete Beach.  Unfortunately, the person who was going to lead the ride is unable to attend.  Information about the ride is unknown.  If you are familiar with the area, we'd love to have you lead this ride.  If you would like to be the guide on this ride, please let Susan know asap by replying to this email.

The initial plan was to start the ride at or near the KOA campground in St. Pete. [masked]th St N, St. Petersburg, FL   (727) 392-2233.  Ride south on the trail.  But if you want to guide the ride, the meeting place and destination of the ride are up to you.  Question about guiding the ride?  Call Sue[masked] cell

description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT PURCHASE YOUR TICKET HERE

Derek Andersen (Startup Grind)

Derek Andersen ‚Äãis the Founder & CEO of Startup Grind, a 400,000 person entrepreneurial community with 200 chapters in 85 countries run by more than 1,000 volunteers. Startup Grind's mission is to help every entrepreneur in the world. It's core values are giving before you take, helping others first, and making friends. Derek Andersen spent four years in product management at Electronic Arts working on games like The Godfather, Burnout, The Sims 3, and Mirror‚Äôs Edge. He left EA in 2009 to start Vaporware Labs, a product incubator which mostly failed but built products including Commonred which was acquired by Income.com in 2012, and Startup Grind. After running Startup Grind as a side project for 2 years, Derek turned his full attention to scaling it from 3 chapters to 200 chapters today. In 2015 Startup Grind will host 1,200 events for 75,000 entrepreneurs. He currently lives in Palo Alto, California but has lived eight years outside the U.S. in France, Germany, Switzerland, New Zealand, and the Cook Islands.

Agenda

10:00 pm Fireside chat

Hosted By Can Kagitcibasi, Istanbul Director

Can started his career at PricewaterhouseCoopers and served in auditing for over 2 years. He moved to San Diego, California in 2009 to get his MBA on Entrepreneurship and Marketing. He started his first Startup, Tum Firsatlar while he was still having his degree in 2010. In late 2012, Can has started his second Startup, Socialeyes, with the goal to disrupt the social networking space. He‚Äôs a passionate person about entrepreneurship, innovation and is a huge foodie. Can is also alumnus of Koc University and Robert College.


Twitter: @cankagit

Global Partner

Google is committed to empowering entrepreneurs around the world through programs, partnerships, and our products.

What is Startup Grind?

Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 200 cities and 85 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. Our monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead. For more information visit StartupGrind.com or follow us on twitter @StartupGrind.
name: Derek Andersen (Startup Grind)

Lifetime Membership is only 100dhs, which along with 50% off at Millennium Corniche, gives you a number of benefits including 10% off all Etihad flights! http://aussiesabroad-abudhabi.com/sponsors/  


Look forward to seeing you then!

Dan

description:

description:
According to Gartner, 94% of businesses are doing some sort of Agile. Yet only few succeed. What makes Agile tick for your business?  Is going Agile worth the trouble? What's the key ingredient to get it right?

This event is hosted and sponsored by NAB.

Helen Snitkovsky is hosting panel discussion between successful business/product owners to help us understand their secret ingredient.


Panel members:

Julia Bearzatto was formally the COO of a company called SecurePay - Australia's largest eCommerce payment company.  She joined as part of the AusPost acquisition and was responsible for leading the growth to help it become a scalable business.  The next step was to set up a new product function and build out the team to help the business work out the next step it needed to take.  Most recently, she has been asked to step into another AusPost subsidiary as a Senior Strategy Manager to sort out a number of other issues over there.

Melissa Ellul was formally the GM of Telstra Retail IT.  She is recognised for driving transformational change, creating a culture of innovation through Agile ways of working and her unrelenting focus on delivering customer value. She was responsible for delivering Telstra‚Äôs Stores of the Future. Most recently, she left Telstra in search of another retailer who wanted to embark on a digital transformation and she found JB Hi-Fi where she is leading the in-store technology and application roadmap and is having lots of fun delivering it.

Rob Alford is a Product Manager at SEEK who works with highly-capable Agile teams to deliver great new products and experiences for people Australia-wide. He was drawn to this role because of the social responsibility and impact he could have on the everyday Australian, in helping them to lead more productive and fulfilling working lives. Having been inspired by Silicon valley icons like Eric Ries, he is now a big advocate of Lean practices across the SDLC and successfully incorporates these ideologies into new projects at SEEK. Originally from the UK, Rob began his professional career in Australia back in 2007 and has spent the last 9 years in a variety of product development and management roles. He is now an active member of the Product Management community in Melbourne, and a regular speaker at Product meetups, conferences and events.


Jonathan Cameron - Senior Product manager from REA Group
name: Story of Agile business

description:
* * * SUNDAY * * *

                                      FREE December Winter Walk

                                           London Loop Section 17

                                      Cockfosters to Enfield Lock

             Ending with 2-course Festive Lunch at Inn On the Park

https://www.tabletable.co.uk/pub-restaurant-menus/Greater-London/Inn-On-The-Park-Enfield/festive_menu.htm

                      Price includes: Festive lunch and PayPal fee.

                                                         * * * * * 

The London Outer Orbital Path ‚Äî more usually the "London LOOP" ‚Äî is a 240-kilometre (150 mi) signed walk along public footpaths, and through parks, woods and fields around the edge of Outer London, England, described as "the M25 for walkers". The walk begins at Erith on the south bank of the River Thames and passes clockwise through Crayford, Petts Wood, Coulsdon, Banstead, Ewell, Kingston upon Thames, Uxbridge, Elstree, Cockfosters, Chingford, Chigwell, Grange Hill and Upminster Bridgebefore ending at Purfleet, almost directly across the Thames from its starting point. Between these settlements the route passes through green buffers and some of the highest points in Greater London.

This extended (start at Oakwood tube) stretch of the London Loop takes in the landscaped grounds of Trent Park, the hills and woods of Enfield Chase, through places known as Botany Bay and Cuckold‚Äôs Hill to the less-than-sylvan pavements of Enfield itself. Click through the gallery for a photo tour.

London Country retreat
Join us for a FREE SUNDAY Winter Walk across 413 acres of rolling meadows, enchanting brooks, exquisite lakes, ancient woodland, and imposing historical sites. Trent park forms part of the London Loop Section 17, and being a country park it provides a natural, rural and tranquil atmosphere right on the outskirts of London on the borders of Enfield.

The walk will limited in member numbers lasting approximately 4.5hrs in total and start at 10am from Cockfosters tube (Piccadilly Line). We will enter Trent Park via the main Cockfosters Road enterance and walk through the ancient woodland and rolling meadows.

We will visit The Mansion, which was Middlesex University, the Solitary Obelisk and Camlet Moat which are just some of the remarkable historical sites and an ornate Water Garden.

Camlet Moat is a scheduled Ancient Monument and is protected under the 1979 Ancient Monument and Archaeological Areas. Nothing is known of the origins of Camlet Moat. The first probable occupant was Richard Pounz, Keeper of the Chase in the 1320s. In 1429 the lodge was demolished and the materials sold to help pay for repairs to Hertford Castle.

Level: 

Easy to Moderate.

Time/Distance: 5hrs - 10miles (16km)

Meeting point: Oakwood Tube (Piccadilly line) station

Meeting time: 9.45am (Walk starts at 10am). Sunday 11th December 2016.

Price includes: Festive lunch and PayPal fee.

Ending with 2-course Festive Lunch at Inn On The Park. See: https://www.tabletable.co.uk/pub-restaurant-menus/Greater-London/Inn-On-The-Park-Enfield/festive_menu.html

The 2-course festive lunch includes PayPal fee= ¬£14.50.

 After lunch we will take the bus from Enfield and return to Oakwood tube (Piccadilly line).

NOTE: Please remember to change your RSVP if you are unable to attend the festive dinner (compulsory) or no longer able to make the event. This is a FREE event so please ensure you update you status allowing plenty of time for others to RSVP, as member numbers are limited for the FREE Winter Walk. Members MUST agree to a 2-course festive lunch. 

Things to bring:
Water
Snacks
Waterproof clothing (weather dependant)
Walking shoes/boots
Money (cash for drinks/Sunday Roast)
Camera (optional)

IMPORTANT NOTE:
By taking part in this meetup you agree to the following disclaimer:

We consider safety to be our number one priority and while we never take unnecessary risks, we do recognise that any outdoor activity involves a danger of personal injury or death. Remember that you should be aware of and accept these risks as you are responsible for your own safety and you should not undertake anything beyond your abilities. It is also your responsibility to be correctly equipped for the weather and activity you have chosen to participate in.


We recommend that everyone participating in outdoor activities obtain appropriate insurance. The BMC offer excellent policies for all outdoor enthusiasts at very competitive rates:https://www.thebmc.co.uk/modules/insurance/Landing.aspx
name: December Winter Walk - London Loop Section 17: Cockfosters to Enfield Lock.

Mora da postoji neki bar polurealan razlog za≈°to je gotivno stripati gomilu  de≈°avanja u sred jeseni... Radi se o Color Blind Studios ekipi. Ovaj tim oformljen je u maju 2016. sa ciljem da prave igre za mobilne ureƒëaje, prvenstveno iOS. Linija 66 - Kreƒáe od Vukovog spomenika. Najbolje je da je saƒçekate na stanici u Ruzveltovoj i idete skroz do kraja jer ona vozi ba≈° do Nauƒçno Tehnolo≈°kog Parka. To je mali autobus, ali va≈æi Busplus kao i u ostalim autobusima gradskog prevoza. On kreƒáe u 18:25 i 18:45.

description:
Combine the adventure of Colorado River rafting with the Milky Way skies over the Grand Canyon, and you have the trip of a lifetime! Everything is provided for in this workshop: prepared meals, air transfers from Las Vegas to the river and back, camping equipment, entertainment, and great photo instruction by NightScape Photographer, Royce Bair.

Two experienced river guides will accompany us on this adventure. This trip and workshop will be similar to our 2016 trip/workshop (check out our 5-star rating and comments), except that we will have two more days and nights on the river, and we will have a much smaller group.

Don't delay making your reservations. Last year, our Grand Canyon workshop filled up less than two weeks after it was announced! These trips are very popular and only a limited number of people are allowed to go down the Grand Canyon each year. Some individuals have waited for up to 20 years to obtain a permit to float through the canyon.

Total Price: Photo workshop fee is $399. River rafting cost is $2750 ($3149 total). See "Cost" and "Other Expenses" below.

What to expect: The river trip is for all ages, 12 years to 82 years old. This is a very mild time of the year, so it should be nice and warm, but not too hot. Although it rarely gets over 100 degrees at this time of the year, a quick dip in the water will cool you off. The large, motorized J-rig rafts are very safe and roomy (we will have 18 passengers and 2 crew people). There are about 60 white water rapids on this 188-mile stretch of the Colorado. You have the option of staying fairly dry in the back of the raft, or getting wet in the front. All your meals are prepared for you (the food is amazing), and all your camping equipment is provided (cots, tents, sleeping bags, chairs and a water-resistant bag to place your camera and other personals). There is some hiking involved (but rarely more that a mile), and this is optional. All transportation and transfers from Las Vegas to and from the river are provided.

The photography workshop portion covers general nature and landscape photography with emphasis on starry night photography, also known as wide-field astrophotography or NightScapes. Participants should already have some standard camera skills, i.e. how to take a correct exposures, and know how to make normal adjustments to their camera. A DSLR (Digital Single Lens Reflex) or mirrorless camera is suggested. One wide angle lens with an f/2.8 aperture (or faster) is also suggested for the NightScapes (additional suggestions will be given to those who register.)

Weather: Mid-May offers the perfect temperatures! May and Sept. are the best months to visit the bottom of the canyon. Day temps are usually 85¬∫ - 95¬∫, with evening temps between 65¬∫ - 75¬∫. April can be a little cold. June, July and August are often over 100¬∫ in the day. The canyon walls radiate stored heat into the evening, typically keeping the temperatures above 80¬∫ much of the night.

See the Overview/Video and Download the Brochure

This is one of my few group workshops for 2018: most are private workshops (with 2-4 people per workshop) going on that year.

Extremely Dark Skies: This remote region has some of our Earth's darkest night skies. The Milky Way literally "pops"! For those who come to do night photography, you will be richly rewarded.

Photo Instruction: I will instruct and guide those that wish to participate on these ten periods:

‚Ä¢ 1st Day - up to 1 hour daytime on-shore photo tour

‚Ä¢ 1st Night - up to 3 hours of starry night photography (weather permitting)

‚Ä¢ 2nd Day - up to 1.5 hours daytime on-shore photo tour

‚Ä¢ 2nd Night - up to 3 hours starry night photography (weather permitting)

‚Ä¢ 3rd Day - up to 1.5 hours daytime on-shore photo tour

‚Ä¢ 3rd Night - up to 3 hours starry night photography (weather permitting)

‚Ä¢ 4th Day - up to 1.5 hours daytime on-shore photo tour

‚Ä¢ 4th Night - up to 3 hours starry night photography (weather permitting)

‚Ä¢ 5th Day - up to 1.5 hours daytime on-shore photo tour

‚Ä¢ 5th Night - up to 3 hours starry night photography (weather permitting)

‚Ä¢ Review and editing of results after the trip 

Photography is optional: The river rafting portion of this trip is mostly about free time and relaxation on the Colorado River, so feel free to bring along a non-photographer friend or family member (these will not have to pay my $399 photo instruction fee).

ITINERARY: 

DAY 1 ¬ª You'll meet your Western River Expeditions crew and rafts at 7:30 AM in Marble Canyon, Arizona, a dramatic launch point on the Colorado River. After a short ride to the river's edge you'll load your duffle bag into a dry bag, listen to a brief orientation from your guides and begin rafting the Grand Canyon. Drift lazily, relax, and then savor lunch on a white sand beach. Mighty House Rock Rapid and the Roaring 20's set the pace for the next several days. Relax at the water's edge in camp while your guides prepare a delicious dinner, then fall asleep to the most incredible star show in the world. Those who have paid the additional $299 photo instruction fee will attend a 2-hour twilight and starry night workshop instruction with Royce Bair before bedding down for the night.

DAY 2 ¬ª After a hearty breakfast prepared by your guides, you'll head downriver for more adventures. Visit Vasey's Paradise, a spectacular cascade of water that supports a lush hanging garden, and Redwall Cavern, a vast chamber carved by the river. Hike breathtaking side canyons or visit ancient Anasazi granaries. Relaxing stretches of river punctuated by exciting whitewater and interesting riverside attractions fill an unforgettable day. An optional afternoon canyon photo instruction tour and a two hour starry night photo workshop will follow after our evening meal.

DAYS 3 & 4 ¬ª After a possible swim in the warm, turquoise waters of the Little Colorado River, you're on your way to Hance, Horn, Granite, Hermit and Crystal...all rapids respected for their huge waves. In the afternoons Royce and the Western River will lead you on short hikes to hidden Elves Chasm and to pounding Deer Creek Falls. After your day of adventure, you‚Äôll savor Western‚Äôs delicious dinners at the river‚Äôs edge and appreciate the unforgettable experience of sleeping under the stars ‚Äî but first we‚Äôll do up to three hours of Milky Way photography for those who wish to share these memories with others back home!


DAY 5 ¬ª You'll spend some time exploring the azure green waters of renowned Havasu Canyon where countless tranquil pools beckon you to find your own private piece of this hidden paradise or explore other possible side canyons and waterfalls throughout this section of Grand Canyon. After dining on Western's famous evening cuisine, capture the dazzling glow of the sun on the towering canyon walls before it slips into the horizon. This will be our last night in the canyon to photograph the Milky Way stars.

DAY 6 ¬ª Vulcan's Anvil, a volcanic cone mid-river, signals the approach of Lava Falls, the Colorado River's most notorious rapid, making rafting the Grand Canyon truly memorable. By mid morning, you'll meet your helicopter that will take you over the canyon rim to Bar Ten Ranch for a shower and lunch, before your return flight to Marble Canyon or Las Vegas.

COST: $2750 to Western River Expeditions, and $399 to me for the photo workshop portion ($3149 total). If you have a friend or family member that is not interested in photography, the only fee is the $2750 to Western River.

Other Expenses: Prior to the start of your rafting vacation, you may choose to meet in either Las Vegas, Nevada and take a charter flight (an additional $275) to Marble Canyon, Arizona where your trip begins or you may meet us directly in Marble Canyon (by driving there yourself).

Other expenses might include airfare to Las Vegas, possible overnight lodging in Las Vegas, possible overnight lodging at The Marble Canyon Lodge*, and a possible Park Entrance Fee ($12) - unless you have a current Nat‚Äôl Park Pass. Western River charges a 1% processing fee ($27.50) and a $6.00 Grand Canyon Conservation Fund contribution. Those last three fees bring the total to $[masked] for the river trip and another $399 to me for photo instruction.

*Marble Canyon Lodge reservations: Mention that you are a Western River guest and request a discount. Reservations for the year don't begin until January 1, 2018. However, make reservations early, as the property does fill. There is a restaurant on the property.

How to Book: 1. You can also book additional non-photographer spots for family members.

The Western River offices are open from 7:00am to 6:00pm MST, Monday - Friday.

Mora da postoji neki bar polurealan razlog za≈°to je gotivno stripati gomilu  de≈°avanja u sred jeseni... (Planiranje bud≈æeta za kulturu za 2017. na osnovu podataka o poseƒáenosti kulturnim dogaƒëajima u proteklih godinu dana odakle se vidi da nas kultura apsolutno ne interesuje, ali po≈°to su pu≈°tali ljude za d≈æabe da prave ≈°utke na Jazz festivalu i harvestuju karte za Aca Lukas & Folk house band ispada da smo popriliƒçno aktivni delovatelji srpskoga kulturnoga miljeJa?)

Sava centar je imao Iana Gilana, Arena ƒáe siroma' uskoro morati ƒçak TRIPUT da pregrmi D≈æibonija i Bregu, ali sa druge strane Save ICT HUB ƒáe biti domaƒáin jo≈° jednom Unity susretu i ovoga puta ugostiti jedan mali studio iz Beograda!

Radi se o Color Blind Studios ekipi. Ovaj tim oformljen je u maju 2016. sa ciljem da prave igre za mobilne ureƒëaje, prvenstveno iOS. U samom razvoju igara uƒçestvuje troje ljudi, sme≈°teni na ƒåukariƒçkoj padini blizu Ade Ciganlije, gde svi zajedno rade. Prvi uspeh ostvarili su igrom "Nukleus", koja je izabrana za featured app na App Store-u u 139 zemalja, ukljuƒçujuƒái SAD, Kanadu i Australiju. Do sada, igra je sakupila preko 180,000 preuzimanja!
Sledeƒáa igra, "Jump or Stay", izlazi poƒçetkom decembra, u saradnji sa Umbrella games.
Igra "Kiss Hero", koja je trenutno i dalje u razvoju, donela im je priliku da se predstave na Casual Connect-u u Tel Avivu.
Pa i pored svega toga, imaju jo≈° prototipa spremnih za razvoj.
Momci ka≈æu da ne planiraju uskoro da prestanu sa radom.

description:
The surprise outcome of the US elections, with Republican control of all THREE branches of government, will engender an immediate, and fundamental, shift in the US healthcare system. Leading US healthcare regulatory and reimbursement experts, Harry Nelson and Amir Inbar, examine the present and interpret the potential future impact on Israeli startups. 


Time: 16:45 - 18:00
Venue: Yigal Arnon law firm, Azrieli Center, Round Building, 47th Floor
Speakers: Harry Nelson, Managing Partner, Nelson Hardiway; Amir Inbar, Mediclever

Harry Nelson, Managing Partner, Nelson Hardiman LLP; Founding Partner, Adaptive Healthcare (LA-based healthcare VC)

Harry Nelson founded Nelson Hardiman LLP, ranked as 2016 "Best Healthcare Law Firm" in California. He is also Founder of Adaptive Healthcare, an LA-based B2B healthcare VC focused on aging in place, telehealth, care coordination, etc. Preferred investment stage is pre-revenue, between SEED and Series A.

Amir Inbar, CEO, Mediclever

As an expert reimbursement consultant, Amir works with organizations ranging from incubator start-ups to publicly traded companies, assisting them with the development of their reimbursement strategies in the US and Europe, their drug/device related value stories and economic models. Prior to Mediclever, Amir worked for various software, telecom and medical device companies (Jungo Software Technologies, Iamba Networks and SuperDimensions), leading marketing, business development and reimbursement activities. Amir runs the reimbursement course at the Graduate Program of the School of Business of the College of Management for MBA students with specialization in biomedical management. Amir holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Law and Economics from the Haifa University and an MBA from the Tel-Aviv University
name: Nov 28: TRUMPcare....What it Means for Israeli Startups

Christmas Startup Mingle (Startup Grind Dar es Salaam)

December is only few weeks away and before we all break for the holidays, we would like to celebrate with partners, sponsors, startup founders in our community, startup enthusiasts, and other small and big businesses in Dar es Salaam. We will have games, karaoke, and great music to facilitate connecting with each other. We'll also have Startup Grind Tshirts on sale! It's FREE ENTRY!

Agenda

6:00 pm Arrival and registration

6:30 pm Karaoke intro

7:30 pm Startup Mingle

8:30 pm Music until late

Hosted By Cynthia Bavo, Dar es Salaam Director

Cynthia Bavo is a communication specialist with work experience in digital marketing, corporate communication and media production. In 2015, she was bit by the entrepreneurship bug and went on to start a digital content creation and events company, Hey it's Cin! that helps entrepreneurs attract their target audience and increase their sales by creating online content that converts, and makes groundbreaking web productions.

Cynthia loves to travel and to tell stories whether love stories or corporate stories or entertaining reality tv stories. Some day, she plans to produce all sorts of reality shows and webseries.


Twitter: @cynthiabavo

Global Partner

Google is committed to empowering entrepreneurs around the world through programs, partnerships, and our products.

What is Startup Grind?

Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 200 cities and 85 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. Our monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead. For more information visit StartupGrind.com or follow us on twitter @StartupGrind.

description:
Dear Gong Friends,

This will be our last Gong Bath session for the year at Purple Turtle Wellbeing.  As the year 2016 comes to an end, and the winter solstice, Christmas and the New Year approaches, this is a time to rejoice, reflect, and be re-born. 

For this Gong session, to embody this cycle, I invite you to welcome the energetic quality of transformation and creation. Bring to the session something you would like to create for the highest good. We are going to work with intention, breath and meditation before being immersed in the sounds of the Gongs, Singing Bowls and Shamanic Instruments. 


The session includes:

-A guided meditation where we will be focusing on the breath, intention and creative visualisation.

-A sound immersion with the sacred sound of the Gong and related therapeutic instruments (singing bowls, chimes, bells, a rain stick, a frame drum, a Koshi, a croaking frog g√ºiro, shakers and leaf rattles).

-Shunyata Period (period of silence for integration purposes).

-closing ritual with the sacred sound Om (you are welcome to listen or join in).

-a cup of tea.

Sessions start 19:30 SHARP. Doors open at 19:15. 

Please arrive early for registration and a cup of herbal tea. Also avoid alcohol and eating heavy meals before the session. Late comers are not admitted to avoid disrupting the session.

 //Please let me know if you are  on your first trimester of pregnancy, suffer from a sound sensitive condition, have a pacemaker, or have any particular need and not sure if the sessions are suitable for you///

--------- 

WHAT TO BRING: Each guest is provided with a yoga mat, a head rest, and an eye pillow but, if possible, please bring: 

 -a cushion/pillow (or cushions/pillows) for extra comfort. You will be laying down for one hour on a yoga mat and the more 'padding' you have underneath you, the more comfortable you will be. And, the more comfortable you are the more beneficial the session will be for you. 

 -a blanket to keep warm because the body temperature may shift during the session. Please contact me if you would like me to bring a blanket for you. 

 -a bottle of water (although there is access to water). You may get thirsty.

WHAT TO WEAR: Please wear loose and comfortable clothing. Changing area available. 

--------- 

HOW TO BOOK

To book pleaseRSVP YES on meet up or contact me ([masked]/[masked])

ENERGY EXCHANGE: ¬£10/¬£8 concession (Note: if you are entitled to the concession rate please contact me as payment on meetup is set to ¬£10 - many thanks).

REFUND POLICY: For organisation purposes, payment or booking confirmation is needed to secure your space. If, for any reason, you need to cancel your booking I ask you to please cancel it with 24 hours in advance. Many thanks.


NOTE: If you prefer to pay cash please contact me. 

--------- 

MAP OF LOCATION 

PHOTO OF ENTRANCE

Looking forward to meet you/see you again.

Gong Blessings,

Patricia (SonicSoul)

description:
Alexander Springs Recreation Area is located in Ocala National Forest in the state of Florida. With forested scenery and abundant spring water, the recreation area offers camping, swimming, kayaking, snorkeling, scuba diving (certified), hiking, biking, and wildlife viewing near the beautiful turquoise waters of Alexander Springs. Ocala NF is located in north central Florida.

The area is subtropical, and surrounded by a floodplain forest. The natural spring water is a constant 72-degrees year round with a sandy bottom. There are still a few campsites remaining the above MLK weekend, and you can reserve one on the federal reservation website (www.recreation.gov) Alexander Springs Recreation Area, or call their toll-free phone number[masked]-6777.

Kayaks and canoes are available for rent from a nearby outfitter for the day. The recreation area has campsites with a picnic table, fire ring, lantern pole, and parking for two vehicles at the campsite. The campground has flush toilets, with hot showers.

Most folks will travel on Friday, Jan. 13, including myself. If you are available to travel on Friday from Columbia you are welcome to carpool with me.

There is also a nearby 22- mile mountain bike trail (Paisley Bike Trail) for folks who may also wish to do some biking.

Please: NO PETS.

LIMIT: 12 PERSONS

For more details contact:  Art Seel [masked]-7401. ([masked])
name: Winter Camping & Paddling Trip to Florida, January 14-16, 2017, MLK Weekend.

description:
This ceremony is taking place on the largest super-moon in 70 years-since the moon is in Taurus we will be healing abundance blocks  and holding a special peace on earth blessing.

Seela-ra Ajna-ra (Katy Starlight) is holding space for a Roof-top fire Ceremony -the ceremony uses channeling, meditation, journey, essential oils and sound to liberate the past, energise the future, raise our vibrations and learn to fall more deeply in love with who we are. 
A Fire ceremony is a sacred ancient way of healing the mind, body and soul. In ceremony with the deepest parts of ourselves we release all that is no longer of service to us. Honouring the Dance of transformation that flickers fire-like in our own consciousness. 
In circle with our tribe, we remember the old ways of our ancestors and open our hearts to learning the way of the stars. We shift through the divine and magical experience of ceremony. Fire-circles brings you back into rhythm with Nature and give you the chance to hear and know what you need for your soul evolution. Together we release with the setting sun so we can awaken more of who we truly are. In circle grandfather fire shows us how to become the fire keepers of our spirit-dreams. 

The fire ceremonies will return late March/early April 2017 as Starlight is off to Japan to teach until then :) 


Please book using the link as the ceremonies tend to sell out.

http://www.starlight-meditation.com/ceremony 

SO MUCH LOVE TO YOU 

Starlight

description: The Hiline trail is one of the most scenic trails in Sedona and has easy access from the Yavapai Vista Parking lot (parking fee) which is on the other side of Hwy 179 across from Bell Rock. This hike will get full sun in the morning so it will warm up fast and should be ideal for a 9am start. The hike will take 2 hours round trip. The first 20 minutes is uphill and then it will flatten out for the remaining 40 minutes and we will return on the same trail as we leave. Bring plenty of water and snacks. Famous Pizza is 5 minutes away in the VOC and might be a nice lunch option. From the VOC travel to the back of beyond traffic circle on Highway 179 and head back to the VOC. The parking lot is on your left right just before you get to Bell Rock. From Sedona get on Highway 179 and take it until you see the Yavapai Vista parking lot on the right side just before Bell Rock which will be on your left.
name: Hike the Hiline Trail  Friday Nov 18th 9am-Pizza optional

description:
Mark your calendars for the last Saturday of every month - Saturday night drum circle is happening again!  Find your groove in this friendly and supportive drum circle!

Recreational group drumming is a great practice that supports health & well-being.  It's transformational:  it can uplift your mood, decrease your blood pressure, decrease anxiety, increase your energy, increase your feelings of connection and IT'S JUST PURE FUN!

Help build and become part of this monthly Saturday night drumming community.  This is a facilitated event; newcomers are always welcome and will be guided into finding their rhythms while more experienced drummers will have the chance to show us their chops while supporting the group experience.  I have plenty of instruments to share (let me know if you need one).

$10.00 donation towards space greatly appreciated.
name: Rhythms of Wellness Drum Circle with Heather Holland
